thread.title: Offensive Struggles Continue As UConn Loses At Cincinnati, 37-13
thread.title_full: Offensive Struggles Continue As UConn Loses At Cincinnati, 37-13

author: Desmond Conner
title: Offensive Struggles Continue As UConn Loses At Cincinnati, 37-13
text:
Offensive Struggles Continue As UConn Loses At Cincinnati, 37-13 
The Huskies traveled to Nippert Stadium to take on the Bearcats on Oct. 24, 2015. (Associated Press) Desmond Conner Contact Reporter UConn's offense outclassed by Cincinnati's as Bearcats win, 37-13 
CINCINNATI – Gunner Kiel threw two touchdowns and ran for another and Andrew Gantz kicked three field goals to lead Cincinnati to a 37-13 win over UConn before a sold-out homecoming game crowd of 40,124 at Nippert Stadium Saturday. 
It was the first conference win of the season for the Bearcats (4-3, 1-2), who were picked to win the AAC East during the preseason. 
Kiel, who threw three touchdowns passes in a 41-0 win over the Huskies last year, had TD tosses of 29 and 26 yards in the first quarter Saturday and he scored on a 1-yard run in the second to push the Bearcats lead to 21-10. 
UConn (3-5, 1-3), scored first, on their first drive, a 4-yard run by Arkeel Newsome, but Kiel’s 2 TD pass were the tying and go-ahead scores and the Huskies did not threaten the rest of the way. 
They got two field goals from kicker Bobby Puyol through the remainder of the game. 
Cincinnati is now 7-0 on its home turf against UConn.
